articles.headline: Owner of Bill Blass Faces Cash Shortage After Acquisition
articles.snippet: The fast-growing buyout firm that owns Bill Blass, Athlete’s Foot and Maggie Moo’s appeared to be on the verge of financial collapse on Monday.
articles.abstract: The fast-growing buyout firm that owns Bill Blass, Athlete’s Foot and Maggie Moo’s appeared to be on the verge of financial collapse on Monday.
articles.lead_paragraph: The fast-growing buyout firm that owns the fashion house Bill Blass, the retailer Athlete’s Foot and the ice cream chain MaggieMoo’s appears to be on the verge of collapse.

articles.headline: Senate Leaders Agree on Housing Aid
articles.snippet: Senate leaders reached a deal on housing legislation that might meet Bush administration approval.
articles.abstract: Senate leaders reached a deal on housing legislation that might meet Bush administration approval.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Senate negotiators on Monday said they had reached a deal on legislation aimed at helping hundreds of thousands of homeowners in danger of foreclosure by expanding the availability of government-insured mortgages.

articles.headline: McCain Finds a Thorny Path in Ethics Effort
articles.snippet: The process of purging John McCain’s campaign of conflicts of interest has focused more attention on his advisers’ backgrounds.
articles.abstract: The process of purging John McCain’s campaign of conflicts of interest has focused more attention on his advisers’ backgrounds.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sorting out the lobbying entanglements of his campaign advisers is proving to be a messy business for Senator John McCain.
articles.byline: By Barry Meier and Kate Zernike

articles.headline: Many Hands, Not Held by China, Aid in Quake
articles.snippet: Thousands of Chinese have streamed into the quake region or donated money in an unscripted response.
articles.abstract: Thousands of Chinese have streamed into the quake region or donated money in an unscripted response.
articles.lead_paragraph: LUCHI, China  Hao Lin had already lied to his wife about his destination, hopped a plane to Chengdu, borrowed a bike and pedaled through the countryside in shorts and leather loafers by the time he reached this ravaged farming village. A psychologist, Mr. Hao had come to offer free counseling to earthquake survivors.
articles.byline: By Jim Yardley and David Barboza

articles.headline: Obama Is Expected to Hit a Milestone in Today’s Votes
articles.snippet: Barack Obama is poised to have a majority of pledged delegates after voting in Kentucky and Oregon, but the situation is delicate as he tries to unify his party.
articles.abstract: Barack Obama is poised to have a majority of pledged delegates after voting in Kentucky and Oregon, but the situation is delicate as he tries to unify his party.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Barack Obama is poised to reach a milestone in the presidential race on Tuesday by capturing a majority of pledged delegates, but he said he would not declare victory against Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton or suggest the Democratic primary should end until the final three contests are finished on June 3.
articles.byline: By Jeff Zeleny and Patrick Healy

articles.headline: South Africans Take Out Rage on Immigrants
articles.snippet: The violence continued to rage on Monday, as police fired rubber bullets and made arrests to try to quell the violence in and around Johannesburg.
articles.abstract: The violence continued to rage on Monday, as police fired rubber bullets and made arrests to try to quell the violence in and around Johannesburg.
articles.lead_paragraph: JOHANNESBURG  The man certainly looked dead, lying motionless in the dust of the squatter camp. His body seemed almost like a bottle that had been turned on its side, spilling blood. His pants were red with the moisture.
articles.byline: By Barry Bearak and Celia W. Dugger

articles.headline: Economic Tide Is Rising for Repo Man
articles.snippet: The recreational boating industry has faltered amid the housing slump, leading to a boom in repossessions.
articles.abstract: The recreational boating industry has faltered amid the housing slump, leading to a boom in repossessions.
articles.lead_paragraph: HARRISON TOWNSHIP, Mich.  So many people have so many things they can no longer afford. This is an excellent time to be a repo man.

articles.headline: A Gamble, but What if He Wins?
articles.snippet: Carl Icahn, the corporate raider turned activist investor, is gambling to bring Microsoft back to the bargaining table and buy Yahoo.
articles.abstract: Carl Icahn, the corporate raider turned activist investor, is gambling to bring Microsoft back to the bargaining table and buy Yahoo.
articles.lead_paragraph: About a month and a half ago, Carl Icahn and I went to dinner at Tse Yang, an upscale Chinese restaurant in Midtown Manhattan. Mr. Icahn, the corporate raider turned activist investor, came blustering through the dimly lit restaurant about 20 minutes late, grabbed one of the waiters  they all know him  and ordered a martini.

articles.headline: Air Taxis Fly Into Financial Turbulence
articles.snippet: The development of the air taxi business, built upon the proposal that commercial air service has become increasingly unreliable for business travel, is threatened by the credit crunch.
articles.abstract: The development of the air taxi business, built upon the proposal that commercial air service has become increasingly unreliable for business travel, is threatened by the credit crunch.
articles.lead_paragraph: With fares rising and commercial air service increasingly unreliable for business travelers, Ed Iacobucci figured his plan for an air taxi service would be a no-lose proposition. So why is Mr. Iacobucci shaking his head in frustration?
